text: You are not your numbers or your past.
author: Anonymous

text: Your value is steady, even when your mood is not.
author: Anonymous

text: You don't need permission to take up space.
author: Anonymous

text: Being is enough before doing.
author: Anonymous

text: Rest is not a reward; it is a right.
author: Anonymous

text: You belong here, exactly as you are.
author: Anonymous

text: You can be unfinished and worthy.
author: Anonymous

text: Saying 'no' protects your best yes.
author: Anonymous

text: Worth is not a bargain price.
author: Anonymous

text: Your pace is allowed to be human.
author: Anonymous

text: Existing is evidence of worth.
author: Anonymous

text: You are not a project; you are a person.
author: Anonymous

text: To love oneself is the beginning of a lifelong romance.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: He who respects himself is safe from others; he wears a coat of mail that none can pierce.
author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

text: You didn’t earn your worth; you came with it.
author: Anonymous

text: Do not audition for your own life—own it.
author: Anonymous

text: Your needs are not negotiations; they are facts.
author: Anonymous

text: Let dignity set your boundaries.
author: Anonymous

text: You fit here without shrinking.
author: Anonymous

text: Be loyal to your future self.
author: Anonymous

text: The room gets better when you believe you belong.
author: Anonymous

text: You are allowed to take up gentle, generous space.
author: Anonymous

text: Your worth is whole on hard days too.
author: Anonymous

text: Let your standards be a soft spine.
author: Anonymous

text: You can be both humble and unapologetically present.
author: Anonymous
